title: How to Reset Location and Privacy Settings on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. [1] X Expert Source Gonzalo Martinez Computer & Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 31 March 2021. The Settings icon has gray cogs on it, and it's usually found on one of your home screens, or within a folder called "Utilities."

steps.title: Tap the General menu.
steps.content: Tap the General menu. It's in the third group of settings. [2] X Research source [3] X Expert Source Gonzalo Martinez Computer & Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 31 March 2021.

steps.title: Tap the Reset.
steps.content: Tap the Reset . It's at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Reset Location & Privacy.
steps.content: Tap Reset Location & Privacy . It's at the bottom of the menu. [4] X Expert Source Gonzalo Martinez Computer & Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 31 March 2021.

steps.title: Enter your passcode.
steps.content: Enter your passcode. This is the code you use to unlock your iPhone or iPad. Once your code is validated, a confirmation message will appear. [5] X Expert Source Gonzalo Martinez Computer & Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 31 March 2021.

steps.title: Tap Reset Settings.
steps.content: Tap Reset Settings . Once you reset these settings, you will need to re-enable location services for apps that you want to allow to collect your location data. If you don't want to reset all of your location and privacy settings, you can learn how to Turn Off Location Services on an iPhone for individual apps.
